subject: Real Estate
title: Dubai: Building a City From Nothing
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dubai: Building a City From Nothing.

hook.text: In 2000, Dubai was mostly desert. Today, the Palm Jumeirah alone has $20 billion in real estate.

buildup.text: Dubai offers zero income tax, golden visas, and freehold ownership for foreigners â€” a magnet for global capital.

discovery.text: The city builds artificial islands, indoor ski slopes, and the world's tallest building to attract investors.

twist.text: Dubai crashed 60% in 2009. Investors fled. Then it rebuilt â€” and is now more expensive than ever.

climax.text: Dubai proves that political will, sovereign wealth, and spectacle can create a global city from sand.

punchline.text: Dubai built a real estate market where there was only desert.

quiz.question: What happened to Dubai's property market in 2009?
